Articles.Content:
Hi all,

So I was reading an article the other day (http://www.engadget.com/2015/01/26/nasa-mars-helicopter/) about how NASA is considering using drone helicopters to explore Mars. This got me to thinking... why not Kerbal? This would be an excellent way to explore non-oxygenated atmospheric bodies without carrying tons of fuel around.

So what I'm wondering is, is there a mod that adds small props like that? I know Firespitter has props, but from what I can see, it hasn't been updated recently, and the props are much too big for what I'm planning.

I've tried using IR rototrons with wings attached, but they are just too slow by themselves, and too unstable stacked for my taste.

Any help is appreciated!
I'm aware of there being some small side-mounted propellors in the USI Exploration Pack. There's also a quadcopter mod somewhere, but I can't recall its name.

Quadcopter/extra small probe parts: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/99066

From Nov 2014 - not sure if it works in 0.90
